page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area lies on the edge of the Lincolnshire Wolds and overlooking an expanse of marsh and fens towards the North Sea.It is mainly a rural farming area.The tower of Burgh-le-Marsh Church 8 miles away across the marsh, can be clearly seen.To the South across the fens Boston Stump can be seen on a clear day;this is some 17 miles away.The small river crossing the area is called the Steeping;this rises in the Wolds(where it was the basis for Tennyson's famous poem The Brook) and flows out to sea at Gibraltar Point,a Nature Reserve on the edge of the Wash.The Halton Parish Church was built is perpendicular style in 1350,it has a lofty tower and fine clerestoried windows.Both Alfred Lord Tennyson and Sir John Franklin, the circumnavigator of the North-West passage were frequent visitors here.
